content: processor that supports 10 concurrent issues to execution units in a single CPU cycle. Figure 2-14 shows the core floor plan, which contains the following units: Figure 2-14 Processor core floor plan  Fixed-point unit (FXU): The FXU handles fixed-point arithmetic.  Load-store unit (LSU): The LSU contains the data cache. It is responsible for handling all types of operand accesses of all lengths, modes, and formats as defined in the z/Architecture.  Instruction fetch and branch (IFB) (prediction) and Instruction cache and merge (ICM). These two sub units (IFB and ICM) contain the instruction cache, branch prediction logic, instruction fetching controls, and buffers. Its relative size is the result of the elaborate branch prediction.  L1D and L1I are incorporated into the LSU and ICM respectively  Instruction decode unit (IDU): The IDU is fed from the IFU buffers, and is responsible for parsing and decoding of all z/Architecture operation codes  Translation unit (XU): The XU has a
